column4: I have a little problem, and hope someone can help me: I have a 500 GB harddisk wich is formatted in FAT32 at the moment, but i need to have files bigger than 4GB on it. But wich filesystem should i use? People get files from my harddisk often, and they all use Windows, it would be a hard job to make all of them install an ext3 driver... I could install NTFS read/write on my Ubuntu, but that might mess up all the files right? And couldn't
the ext3 driver do the same ?
you could put the big drive on a linux pc and share the disk over samba
yes i know - but the file transfer is only 100mb/s then. But it might be the only solution if not the NTFS writing is reliable yet?
I did not have any problems with it. but its still not stable. Might get buggered with permissions as well
100 mb/s isn`t enough?
Were talking big files, and a lot of them... And it would just be easiest if it was directly connected... I might look into NTFS, but i would really hate to loose 500 GB of data
I hear that :/
NTFS Reading is splendid. its the writing that gives the problems
I know but i will be doing a lot of writing
I am primarily using the harddisk on my own computer under Ubuntu... And thats where most files are written from. The ext3 driver might me more safe for me, but it would annoy a lot of people
Just smack your users and make them use linux. But sorry, I dont have any other ideas (except mixing virtual machines and samba shares in them and a lot of weirdness
well your right! It is not my problem that they can't have access, they should use a good stable system instead of Windows, lol, I am going to format it in ext3 ;)
^_^ Thats the spirit
I just got an idea, could I have 2 partitions on the drive or something, one in FAT32 which contains a setup-file for the ext3 for Windows, and a partition with all the other files in ext3
you could also put the setup file on the ntfs part. from windows
what does that command do? Can it also remove directories containing files?
remove recursivly. so the dir and all in it
NICE! I have looked for that command for ages :P
*Bows*
be very very VEEEERY carefull though
why ?
and thats why we have to be careful?
usser, well it doesn`t check. it doesn`t ask it just deletes
